snippet: As the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey’s executive director, Patrick J. Foye halted the vindictive snarling of traffic at the George Washington Bridge. For his trouble, he is losing his job.
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column examines accomplishments of Port Authority of New York and New Jersey executive director Patrick J Foye, who called attention to George Washington Bridge scandal involving aides and appointees of New Jersey Gov Chris Christie; praises Foye for having courage to stand up to near-gangsterism at agency.
lead_paragraph: As the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey’s executive director, Patrick J. Foye halted the vindictive snarling of traffic at the George Washington Bridge. For his trouble, he is losing his job.

headline.main: Integrity Takes a Toll at the Port Authority

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Port Authority of New York and New Jersey
